( Carnage: Not making a big deal of it, Yanshosh. Simply stating the 
facts.And I understand your mistake. And, I never realized that you shot at 
Dinobot, CODE, however, it's too late to post them now.)

* Dinobot's breathing was quick and uneven, the pain in both his side and 
chest the most extreme he had ever felt.
The armor which had covered his side and half his chest was now completely 
gone, the volnerable circuits belieth covered in a constantly flowing sheet 
of mech-fluid.
His head still bowed and the sight in his left optic gone, he simply kneeled 
there and collected himself. Actually forced to push back the incredable 
pain from his wounds with only his will power, his back becoming slick with 
the sweat it took to keep the pain tollerable.
He just KNEW that he wouldn't be able to make it back to the CF in one 
piece, the hint of battle always in his mind the second he had stopped in 
this clearing.
No matter how peaceful, no matter how quant, the thought was always there.
Dinobot missed the sounds of Prowls beating feet as the Maximal ran up to 
him, his optics clenched shut and his teeth bared and jaw clenched.
However, as he opened his optics he finally heard Prowl's words, turning his 
head towards the Maximal very slowly while taking in a long and very painful 
breath.
But Prowl was on his blind side, and even turning his head to see the comrad 
sent a splitting pain down his spine.
A snarl trickled through his clenched teeth as he turned his head towards 
the ground once again, bowing his head while he coll,ected enough energy to 
do exactly the last thing he wanted to do right that moment.
With more will power then he knew he stood, grunting as he straightened out 
his knees and alighned his spine so that he was standing upright.
If he would have had any shade of real color, he would have just pailed. The 
pain had increased, and if he was any less a man he would have whimpered in 
pain.
However, he simply swallowed that whimper and looked towards Prowl with his 
good optic.*

" I can make it...on...my own."

* He then looked out around the clearing, noticing that it was now 
completely dystroyed! All of it, completely gone! There were charge craters 
every where, and downed trees, mech-fluid.
This glade was no longer the peaceful dwelling in which Tavatron and himself 
had relaxed in only 40 cycles ago. Now, now it was a battlefield.
Dinobot growled, it sounding a little wet thanks to the mech-fluid which was 
now working it's way up his throat.
He spat the fluid from his throat as another thought entered his mind: 
Tavatron.
Where was she, and was she injured?
The area on which his good optic looked over didn't hold her within it's 
sight, so that meant that she would have to be on his blind side.
All that mattered to him was getting her back to the CF and away from Harm, 
they also had no way of defeating the Alliance giant...so the battle was 
lost on their part.*
